title: Bug 14197: Immediately removing a working set triggers unwanted changes
description: When removing a working set, it immediately triggers changes in the package view in the background. However, I believe the package view should only be refiltered when closing the working set selection dialog, not during working set manipulation. Additionally, I expect pressing cancel to revert all changes made to working sets, including canceling the removal action.
OB:
1. Create a working set with one project and select it. The package view should be filtered accordingly.
2. Open the working set dialog again, create a second working set, and delete the first one.
EB: When removing a working set, the package view should not be refiltered immediately. The refiltering should only occur when closing the working set selection dialog. Canceling the removal action should revert all changes made to working sets.
SR:
1. In the working set dialog, create a working set with one project and select it to filter the package view.
2. Open the working set dialog again, create a second working set, and delete the first one.
